fields.name: Headline
fields.default: Software I use, gadgets I love, and other things I recommend.

fields.name: Subheadline
fields.default: I get asked a lot about the things I use to build software, stay productive, or buy to fool myself into thinking I'm being productive when I'm really just procrastinating. Here's a big list of all of my favorite stuff.

tools.title: 16" MacBook Pro, M1 Max, 64GB RAM (2021)
tools.description: I was using an Intel-based 16" MacBook Pro prior to this and the difference is night and day.

tools.title: Apple Pro Display XDR (Standard Glass)
tools.description: The only display on the market if you want something HiDPI and bigger than 27".

tools.title: IBM Model M SSK Industrial Keyboard
tools.description: They don't make keyboards the way they used to.

tools.title: Sublime Text 4
tools.description: I don't care if it's missing all of the fancy IDE features everyone else relies on, Sublime Text is still the best text editor ever made.

tools.title: iTerm2
tools.description: I'm honestly not even sure what features I get with this that aren't just part of the macOS Terminal but it's what I use.

tools.title: TablePlus
tools.description: Great software for working with databases. Has saved me from building about a thousand admin interfaces.

tools.title: Figma
tools.description: We started using Figma as just a design tool but now it's become our virtual whiteboard for the entire company.

tools.title: Alfred
tools.description: It's not the newest kid on the block but it's still the fastest. The Sublime Text of the application launcher world.

tools.title: Reflect
tools.description: Using a daily notes system instead of trying to keep things organized by topics has been super powerful for me.

tools.title: SavvyCal
tools.description: Great tool for scheduling meetings while protecting my calendar and making sure I still have lots of time for deep work.

tools.title: Focus
tools.description: Simple tool for blocking distracting websites when I need to just do the work and get some momentum going.
